name: fortinet-fortirecon-aci
label: Fortinet FortiRecon ACI
description:
FortiRecon is a Digital Risk Protection Service (DRPS) product that provides an outside-the-network view to the risks posed to your enterprise.The Adversary Centric Intelligence (ACI) module leverages FortiGuard Threat Analysts to provide comprehensive coverage of dark web, open source, and technical threat intelligence, including threat actor insights. This information enables administrators to proactively assess risks, respond faster to incidents, better understand their attackers, and protect assets. This connector facilitates the automated operations related to ACI.

This connector has a dependency on the Threat Intel Management Solution Pack. Install the Solution Pack before enabling ingestion of Threat Feeds from this source.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL or IP address of the FortiRecon server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key configured for your account for using the Fortinet FortiRecon ACI APIs.

fields.name: org_id
fields.title: Organization ID
fields.description: Specify the organization ID for which you will fetch the records using the Fortinet FortiRecon ACI connector.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. 
By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get IOCs
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all IOCs or specific IOCs published in ACI reporting for the given organization ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: report_id
parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of report IDs from which you want to fetch the IOCs.

parameters.name: ioc_type
parameters.title: IOC Type
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the type of IOCs you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, cve,IP-REPUTATION

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date from when you want to retrieve IOCs from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date till when you want to retrieve IOCs from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.
parameters.description: Specify the page number from which to retrieve results.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.placeholder: Must be greater 0 and less than or equal to 500.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, it retrieves 10 records.
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, it retrieves 10 records. Must be greater 0 and less than or equal to 500.

operations.title: Get Leaked Cards
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all leaked cards or specific leaked cards found for the given organization ID and other input parameters you have specified from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

parameters.name: type
parameters.title: Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of leaked card you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

parameters.name: bin
parameters.title: Bin
parameters.description: Specify the bin associated with the leaked card you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, 123456,654321

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date from when you want to retrieve leaked cards from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date till when you want to retrieve leaked cards from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD).

operations.title: Get Reports
operations.description:
Retrieves a list of all reports or specific reports for the given organization ID and other input parameters you have specified from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.
The data returned by this operation contains a list of all the filtered reports with title, summary, report URL, and the metadata related to the reports. Note that IOCs are not included in the returned data.

parameters.name: relevance_rating
parameters.title: Relevance Rating
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the relevance ratings of the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, Medium,High,Low

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the tags associated with the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, Data Breach,Cyber Crime

parameters.name: adversary
parameters.title: Adversary
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the adversary associated with the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, Databases,APT 34

parameters.name: source_category
parameters.title: Source Category
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the source category associated with the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, OSINT,Darknet

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.title: Report Type
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the type of reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, Flash Report,Flash Alert

parameters.name: industry
parameters.title: Industry
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the industry associated with the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, All Sectors,Technology

parameters.name: geography
parameters.title: Geography
parameters.tooltip: Should be comma separated string or single string.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated string or single string of the geography of the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. For example, Western Europe,South East Asia

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.description: Specify the keyword using which you want to filter the reports retrieved from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

parameters.name: source_reliability
parameters.title: Source Reliability
parameters.description: Specify the source reliability of the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

parameters.name: information_reliability
parameters.title: Information Reliability
parameters.description: Specify the information reliability of the reports you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date from when you want to retrieve reports from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Now - 6 months (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Should be Date or Default is Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.description: Specify the date till when you want to retrieve reports from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI. By default, this is set to Current Date (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.
parameters.description: Specify the page number from which to retrieve results.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.placeholder: Must be greater 0 and less than or equal to 500.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, it retrieves 10 records.
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return for the specified page. By default, it retrieves 10 records. Must be greater 0 and less than or equal to 500.

operations.title: Get Reports With IOCs
operations.description:
Retrieves details, including IOCs, for a specific report for the given organization ID and the report ID you have specified from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.
The data returned by this operation contains a list of all the filtered reports with title, summary, report URL, IOCs, and the metadata related to the reports.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Report ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the report whose details, including IOCs, you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiRecon ACI.

operations.title: Get ICL Saved Searches
operations.description: Retrieves a list of intelligence collection lookup saved searches for the given org id and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in saved searches by searching the given keyword in sources, query fields.
parameters.description: Specify a keyword to search in saved searches by searching the given keyword in sources, query fields.

parameters.name: alert
parameters.title: Alert
parameters.tooltip: Select 'True' to retrieve the list of saved searches that are enabled for notifications.
parameters.description: Select 'True' to retrieve the list of saved searches that are enabled for notifications.

parameters.name: query_type
parameters.title: Query Type
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific query type. You can select between SYSTEM and USER.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific query type. You can select between SYSTEM and USER.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a saved search was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a saved search was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a saved search was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a saved search was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

parameters.description: Specify the saved search ID to fetch its details.

parameters.description: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a saved search was added. Default is last 12 months.

operations.title: Get Leaked Stealers Infections
operations.description: Retrieves a list of leaked stealers infections for the given org id and the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in leaked stealers infections by searching the given keyword in username, stealer name.
parameters.description: Specify a keyword to search in leaked stealers infections by searching the given keyword in username, stealer name.

parameters.name: stealer_name
parameters.title: Stealer Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific stealer name. Multiple stealer names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Vidar,Redline,Racoon,AZORult,risepro.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific stealer name. Multiple stealer names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Vidar,Redline,Racoon,AZORult,risepro.

parameters.name: affiliated_domain
parameters.title: Affiliated Domain
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific affiliated domain. Multiple affiliated domains should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: domain1.com,domain2.com
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific affiliated domain. Multiple affiliated domains should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: domain1.com,domain2.com

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status of leaked stealers infections, you can select between ACTIVE and RESOLVED.
parameters.description: Specify the status of leaked stealers infections, you can select between ACTIVE and RESOLVED.

parameters.title: User Type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the user type of leaked stealers infections, you can select between EMPLOYEE and USER.
parameters.description: Specify the user type of leaked stealers infections, you can select between EMPLOYEE and USER.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a leaked stealers infection was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a leaked stealers infection was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a leaked stealers infection was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a leaked stealers infection was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.description: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Vulnerability Intelligence CVEs
operations.description: Retrieves a list Vulnerability Intelligence CVEs for the given organization ID and the input parameters specified.

parameters.name: input_src_type
parameters.title: Input Source Type
parameters.tooltip: Select the input source type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between client and aci.
parameters.description: Select the input source type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between client and aci.

parameters.name: recon_severity
parameters.title: Fortirecon Severity
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW.
parameters.description: Select the severity based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW.

parameters.name: nvd_severity
parameters.title: NVD Severity
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW.
parameters.description: Select the severity based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM and LOW.

parameters.name: years
parameters.title: CVE Year
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific CVE year. Multiple CVE years should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 2018,2019.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific CVE year. Multiple CVE years should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 2018,2019.

parameters.name: input_src_subtype
parameters.title: Addition
parameters.tooltip: Select the addition type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between EASM and MANUAL.
parameters.description: Select the addition type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between EASM and MANUAL.

parameters.name: vuln_exploitation
parameters.title: Vulnerability Exploitation
parameters.tooltip: Select the Vulnerability Exploitation type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between APT_GROUP, RANSOMWARE and UNKNOWN.
parameters.description: Select the Vulnerability Exploitation type based on which you want to filter the result. You can select between APT_GROUP, RANSOMWARE and UNKNOWN.

parameters.name: vendors
parameters.title: Vendors
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific vendor. Multiple vendors should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: debian,canonical,nodejs,openssl.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific vendor. Multiple vendors should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: debian,canonical,nodejs,openssl.

parameters.name: products
parameters.title: Products
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific product. Multiple products should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: debian_linux,ubuntu_linux,openssl.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific product. Multiple products should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: debian_linux,ubuntu_linux,openssl.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tag IDs
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific tag ID. Multiple tag IDs should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 65dd1123aa1d5e9ab668ac56,56dd1768aa1d5o9ab668ac56..
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific tag ID. Multiple tag IDs should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 65dd1123aa1d5e9ab668ac56,56dd1768aa1d5o9ab668ac56..

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.title: Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific keyword. Provided keyword will be partially searched in these fields: cve id, . Example: CVE-2018.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific keyword. Provided keyword will be partially searched in these fields: cve id, . Example: CVE-2018.

parameters.name: is_elevated
parameters.title: Elevated
parameters.tooltip: Select 'True' to fetch elevated CVEs.
parameters.description: Select 'True' to fetch elevated CVEs.

parameters.description: Select the sort by type based on which you want to sort the result. You can select between recon_score:desc or recon_score:asc.

parameters.description: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a vulnerability intelligence CVE was added.

operations.title: Get Stealers Infections On Sale
operations.description: Retrieves a list of stealers infections on sale for the given org id and the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: search_string
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in stealers infections on sale by searching the given keyword in stealer name, sites, country, isp, state.
parameters.description: Specify a keyword to search in stealers infections on sale by searching the given keyword in stealer name, sites, country, isp, state.

parameters.name: stealers
parameters.title: Stealer Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific stealer name. Multiple stealer names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Vidar,Redline,Racoon,AZORult,risepro.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific stealer name. Multiple stealer names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Vidar,Redline,Racoon,AZORult,risepro.

parameters.name: marketplaces
parameters.title: Marketplace Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific marketplace name. Multiple marketplace names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 2easy,genesis,russian market.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific marketplace name. Multiple marketplace names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: 2easy,genesis,russian market.

parameters.name: isps
parameters.title: ISP Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific ISP name. Multiple ISP names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Amazon.com,IRANET TELECOM.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific ISP name. Multiple ISP names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: Amazon.com,IRANET TELECOM.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.title: Country Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific country name. Multiple country names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: India,Colombia.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific country name. Multiple country names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: India,Colombia.

parameters.name: states
parameters.title: State Name
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific State name. Multiple State names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: India,Colombia.
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific State name. Multiple State names should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: India,Colombia.

parameters.name: matched_domains
parameters.title: Matched Domain
parameters.tooltip: Filter the results by specific matched domain. Multiple matched domains should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: domain1.com,domain2.com
parameters.description: Filter the results by specific matched domain. Multiple matched domains should be comma separated and will work as OR filter, example: domain1.com,domain2.com

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status of stealers infections on sale, you can select between ACTIVE and RESOLVED.
parameters.description: Specify the status of stealers infections on sale, you can select between ACTIVE and RESOLVED.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a stealers infection on sale was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a stealers infection on sale was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date

parameters.description: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a stealers infection on sale was added. Default is the current date.
